If you already have a personal injury attorney but are not happy with his or her services, it‚Äôs okay to change representation, even mid-case. We‚Äôll walk you through the process.

Steps for Filing a Personal Injury Claim

It‚Äôs essential to have a general idea of each step of the legal process. These steps can be altered, depending on the specifics of your case. Your personal injury lawyer can address any concerns you may have along the way.

Consultation

When you contact one of our compassionate personal injury lawyers in Atlanta, we can help you decide whether or not to go forward with legal action. During this case evaluation, your attorney will look at the details of your accident and begin to determine negligence.

File Your Personal Injury Claim

Once it gets established that you have a valid case, your attorney will begin by drafting and filing your personal injury claim to submit to the Georgia civil court system. You can choose, at this point, to pursue negotiations for a personal injury settlement or an in-house trial.

Mediation, also known as settlement negotiations, in personal injury cases is when both parties and their respective insurance companies meet outside of court to reach an agreement. It‚Äôs ideal and cost-effective if the case settles out of court in mediation.

Should you pursue a civil trial, you can expect to undergo:

Discovery

Opening statement

Examination

Cross-examination

Closing statements

Deliberation

How Much Time Do I Have to File an Injury Case in Atlanta?

The time limit, or statute of limitations, within which you can legally file a claim varies greatly. That‚Äôs why the sooner you call a lawyer near you, the better. According to OCGA ¬ß9-3-33, you have two years from the date of your injuries or your family member‚Äôs death to file your personal injury claim.

These statutes of limitations are relevant for civil cases such as car accidents, wrongful death, and other personal injury claims.

That said, government entities, Native American reservations, and cruise ships all have their own laws. In these cases, the statute of limitations period could be very, very short, in some cases just weeks.

How Much Money Is This Going to Cost Me?

Hiring a car accident lawyer will not cost you anything upfront. We take our fee as a percentage of your settlement. That‚Äôs zero charges upfront and zero charges if we should not make a recovery. You have no risk.

Our goal in all our cases is to get our clients as much money as we can as quickly as we can. The first and most important part, however, is getting you healthy and back to your life as much as possible. Then we can put a value on your case.

You can get a free consultation no matter how many times you need our advice, and our personal injury lawyer‚Äôs service costs nothing until your case is officially won. We don‚Äôt take cases we don‚Äôt think we can win.

How Much Will My Settlement Be?

This is a question that doesn‚Äôt have one concrete answer. How much your settlement will depend on the type of personal injury case you‚Äôre filing a claim for. For example, a moderate car accident case will recover around $30,000. Still, a severe car accident that leads to permanent disability or disfigurement can lead to a settlement worth several million dollars.

This all depends on a few key factors:

How severe your accident was

The damages you have sustained

How severe your damages are and how much they‚Äôve negatively impacted your life

Whether or not you can work after your accident

There‚Äôs so much that goes into the value of your settlement that it‚Äôs impossible to tell how much it‚Äôs worth without first consulting with one of our personal injury attorneys.

What if You Are Partly at Fault?

According to the Official Code of Georgia Annotated (OCGA) ¬ß51-12-33, Georgia follows a modified comparative negligence rule. Therefore, if you, the plaintiff, are found guilty by the courts to be more than 50% at fault for the accident, you will lose the right to any recovery. However, you are still eligible for compensation if you are less than 49% responsible.

The judge will reduce the amount you are awarded damages in proportion to the percentage of fault. For example, a plaintiff the courts find 10% responsible for the accident would receive $90,000 of a $100,000 award or 90% of the total award amount.

We‚Äôre larger than most firms so we don‚Äôt have the financial pressures to settle a case right away. If the trial needs 10 expert witnesses, we have the cash flow to support that. We‚Äôve been in business for more than 25 years and we‚Äôre successful at what we do. Our advocates have long-term relationships with healthcare providers and professionals. We can counsel you toward the best medical care. And because we have a comfortable inventory of cases, no one file is going to impact us so much that a Foy car accident lawyer would push you to settle. We can afford to go the distance and maximize your case.

How a Personal Injury Lawyer in Atlanta Can Help

There are many reasons it‚Äôs worth getting a personal injury attorney in Atlanta after an accident. Here are just a few of the things we will do for you to make winning a settlement easier.

Gathering Evidence Related to Your Claim

Even though the law supports you with the right to file a claim, that doesn‚Äôt mean you automatically receive financial compensation. You still have to prove fault and negligence with solid evidence. While you rest and recover from your injuries, our lawyers will be hard at work looking for evidence and other critical information to support your claim.

Representing Your Best Interests

You don‚Äôt have to negotiate on your own or go to court. We will represent your best interests at all times and ensure that your voice gets heard. We won‚Äôt let the insurance company dominate the floor and make you look bad. Our goal is to win you the best settlement possible for your claim, and we will fight hard for you.

Consulting with Professionals

Even with strong evidence, sometimes you‚Äôll need extra support to ensure that the insurance company can‚Äôt weasel their way out of paying you a fair settlement. We can consult with medical professionals, accident reconstruction experts, and forensic experts to support your case. This way, there is no doubt or uncertainty that the negligent party was at fault for what happened to you.

Calculating Your Damages Accurately

Calculating your damages accurately can be confusing. There‚Äôs a lot more that goes into it than just adding up bills and receipts. We can also calculate future medical expenses and non-economic damages that don‚Äôt have a fixed monetary value. So we won‚Äôt leave a single penny off of your final settlement total.

No one should ever give a recorded statement to an insurance company, even their own insurance company, without consulting an attorney first.

What Questions Can I Expect in the Initial Interview?

In your free consultation, an experienced car accident lawyer will ask some important questions about your situation:

What is the extent of your injuries?

Are the damages permanent?

Is there scarring?

Do you need time away from work?

How much are the medical bills?

Do you need future treatment?

Were you on the job when it happened?

Will you need a vehicle?

Our personal injury lawyers address property damage and your health first. You need to get back to work; you need to go to the doctor. We get you medical care if you don‚Äôt have insurance. Our goal is to get you back to optimal health before we even put a price tag on the case. Your responsibility is to follow your doctor‚Äôs instructions and get the prescribed help necessary.
